DOC.brief_summary: Trigger finger, also known as stenosing tenosynovitis, is a painful condition that can cause discomfort and disability. Many physicians choose to locally inject cortisone into the infected finger although there is no current consensus as to how many injections are needed to achieve maximum relief. This study will be a prospective, randomized study to compare one versus two injections for the treatment of trigger finger.
DOC.brief_title: Study Comparing One Versus Two Cortisone Injections for Trigger Finger
DOC.criteria: Subject is greater than 18 years of age, presenting with stenosing tenosynovitis. Subject is willing and able to provide informed consent. Patients who have previously undergone surgery for the treatment of trigger finger.
